member.summary: Runs the transition.

member.name: T:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.FrameSectionsTransitionInfo
member.summary: Represents the transition information for a .

member.summary: The type of .

member.name: P:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.FrameSectionsTransitionInfo.SuppressTransition
member.summary: Gets the transition info for a suppressed transition. There is not visual animation when using this transition info.

member.name: P:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.FrameSectionsTransitionInfo.FadeInOrFadeOut
member.summary: The new frame fades in or the previous frame fades out, depending on the layering.

member.name: P:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.FrameSectionsTransitionInfo.SlideUp
member.summary: The new frame slides up, hiding the previous frame.

member.name: P:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.FrameSectionsTransitionInfo.SlideDown
member.summary: The previous frame slides down, revealing the new frame.

member.name: P:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.FrameSectionsTransitionInfo.NativeiOSModal
member.summary: The frames are animated using a UIViewController with the default configuration.

member.name: T:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.FrameSectionsTransitionInfoTypes
member.summary: Represents the supported types of .

member.name: F:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.FrameSectionsTransitionInfoTypes.FrameBased
member.summary: The transition is applied by changing properties or animating properties of objects. This is associated with the class.

member.name: F:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.FrameSectionsTransitionInfoTypes.UIViewControllerBased
member.summary: The transition is applied by using the native iOS transitions offered by UIKit. This is associated with the class.

member.summary: The modal name associated with this UIViewController.

member.name: P:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.ModalViewController.OpeningTransitionInfo
member.summary: The used when opening this modal. This is reused for the closing transition info when closing natively.

member.name: E:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.ModalViewController.ClosedNatively
member.summary: This event is raised when the UIViewController was closed natively, meaning that the was not responsible for the close operation. This can happen when the user uses a native gesture.

member.summary: Closes this UIViewController.
member.param: The transition info affecting the native animation.

member.summary: This event is raised when a modal was closed natively. This can only happen when using a native modal (with ).

member.summary: Removes a Frame with the specified name.

member.name: T:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.MultiFrame.FrameInfo
member.summary: This class is used to associate properties with a instance.

member.name: P:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.MultiFrame.FrameInfo.Frame
member.summary: The frame associated with the other properties.

member.name: P:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.MultiFrame.FrameInfo.State
member.summary: The state of the frame visually. This is used to cleanup frames when changing states.

member.name: P:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.MultiFrame.FrameInfo.Index
member.summary: The index of the frame in the its parent collection. This is used to chose which animation to use when changing sections.

member.name: P:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.MultiFrame.FrameInfo.Priority
member.summary: The priority used to order frames in their parent collection. This ensures that modal are on top of sections and that modals are ordered even when opened with custom priorities.

member.name: T:Chinook.SectionsNavigation.UIViewControllerSectionsTransitionInfo
member.summary: This implementation of is used to animate frames using native iOS animations. This class allows you to leverage the various built-in options from UIKit. This class is only supported on iOS.
